poem:
Title: Existence, In Landscape of Folly

In amber of turmoil, we live,
our hollow tomorrows wrapped in today's print,
the pigs play, the world spins,
ball pits of levity, amidst the din.

Governments hide, men vote strange,
and here we wage, culture wars in change.
In our collective confusion, we sigh unseen,
unraveled threads, woven in the loom of routine.
